title: ASCOD Algorithm for Ischemic Stroke
description: Assigns phenotype in patients with ischemic stroke of uncertain causes by evaluating five main etiologic categories: Atherothrombosis, Small-vessel disease, Cardiac pathology, Other causes, and Dissection. Provides a comprehensive classification system that captures overlap between multiple underlying stroke mechanisms.

parameters.name: atherosclerosis
parameters.description: Atherosclerosis grade. Grade 1: Ipsilateral stenosis 50-99% supplying area of ischemia. Grade 2: Ipsilateral stenosis 30-49%. Grade 3: Plaque without stenosis or <30% in any territory. Grade 0: No atherosclerotic disease. Grade 9: Incomplete workup

parameters.name: small_vessel_disease
parameters.description: Small vessel disease grade. Grade 1: Lacunar syndrome with relevant subcortical infarct <15mm. Grade 2: Incomplete lacunar syndrome or infarct 15-20mm. Grade 3: WMH/microbleeds without qualifying syndrome. Grade 0: No SVD. Grade 9: Incomplete workup

parameters.name: cardiac_pathology
parameters.description: Cardiac pathology grade. Grade 1: High-risk sources (AF, mitral stenosis, recent MI, endocarditis). Grade 2: Low/uncertain risk (PFO with ASA). Grade 3: Minor-risk sources. Grade 0: No cardiac pathology. Grade 9: Incomplete workup

parameters.name: other_causes
parameters.description: Other causes grade (vasculitis, hematologic disorders, genetic conditions). Grade 1: Disease directly causing stroke. Grade 2: Disease present, causal link uncertain. Grade 3: Disease present, unlikely related. Grade 0: No other causes. Grade 9: Incomplete workup

parameters.name: dissection
parameters.description: Dissection grade. Grade 1: Dissection demonstrated in relevant artery. Grade 2: Imaging suggestive but not diagnostic. Grade 3: Dissection in non-relevant artery. Grade 0: No dissection. Grade 9: Incomplete workup

ranges.description: At least one potentially causal mechanism identified
ranges.interpretation: Consider targeted secondary prevention for identified mechanism(s). May require multiple therapeutic approaches if multiple grade 1 mechanisms are present.

ranges.description: Causal link uncertain for identified mechanism(s)
ranges.interpretation: Mechanism present but relationship to stroke uncertain. Consider secondary prevention based on overall risk profile and clinical judgment.

ranges.description: Disease present but causal link unlikely
ranges.interpretation: Underlying condition identified but not likely causative for this stroke. May still require management for overall cardiovascular risk reduction.
Further diagnostic workup needed to complete stroke classification. Consider additional testing as clinically appropriate.
Comprehensive workup negative for common stroke mechanisms. Consider rare causes or repeat evaluation if clinically indicated.

references: Amarenco P, Bogousslavsky J, Caplan LR, Donnan GA, Wolf ME, Hennerici MG. The ASCOD phenotyping of ischemic stroke (Updated ASCO phenotyping). Cerebrovasc Dis. 2013;36(1):1-5. doi: 10.1159/000352050.

Sirimarco G, Lavallée PC, Labreuche J, Meseguer E, Cabrejo L, Guidoux C, et al. Overlap of diseases underlying ischemic stroke: the ASCOD phenotyping. Stroke. 2013 Dec;44(12):3427-33. doi: 10.1161/STROKEAHA.113.001363.
Radu RA, Terecoasă EO, Băjenaru OA, Tiu C. Etiologic classification of ischemic stroke: Where do we stand? Clin Neurol Neurosurg. 2017 Aug;159:93-106. doi: 10.1016/j.clineuro.2017.05.019.
formula: ASCOD phenotype = A-S-C-O-D where each letter represents the causality grade (0, 1, 2, 3, or 9) for: A=Atherothrombosis, S=Small-vessel disease, C=Cardiac pathology, O=Other causes, D=Dissection
notes: Grade 9: Incomplete workup - further evaluation needed
Grade 1: Potentially causal - direct relationship to stroke likely
Grade 2: Causal link uncertain - mechanism present but relationship unclear
Grade 3: Causal link unlikely but disease present - condition exists but not stroke-causative
Grade 0: No disease detected in this category
Multiple mechanisms can be graded simultaneously, reflecting stroke complexity
Results guide comprehensive secondary prevention strategies
More detailed than traditional TOAST classification
Encourages thorough diagnostic workup for stroke etiology
